title: Daily Plannner Generator
goal: Help the users to organise the day clearly with priorities
prompt: Create a structured daily planner for {user_type} focusing on {main_goal} with time management and priorities.

responses.gpt-5:

responses.gemini-2.5:
## College Student Daily Planner: Focus on Timely Assignments â°

This structured planner uses time blocking and a priority system to help you manage your day and ensure assignments are completed without last-minute stress.

---

### I. Morning Prep & High-Priority Block (7:00 AM â€“ 11:30 AM)

| Time Slot | Activity | Focus/Priority | Notes/Assignment |
| :---: | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 7:00 AM | Wake Up & Get Ready | **Personal Care** | (Hydrate, light exercise, quick breakfast) |
| 8:00 AM | **Priority Block 1 (Deep Work)** | **A** - Start/Complete most difficult assignment/reading (or work on assignment **due today**). | *Goal: 90 minutes of focused, distraction-free work.* |
| 9:30 AM | Class/Lecture | **Academic** | (Check syllabus for pre-reading) |
| 10:30 AM | Brief Break | **Refuel** | (Stretch, walk, snack) |
| 11:00 AM | **Priority Block 2** | **B** - Review class notes, organize materials for next class, or work on second most difficult assignment. | *Start on work due tomorrow/day after.* |

---

### II. Afternoon Academic & Administration (11:30 AM â€“ 4:30 PM)

| Time Slot | Activity | Focus/Priority | Notes/Assignment |
| :---: | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 11:30 AM | Lunch & Socialize | **Rest & Recharge** | (Keep it to 45-60 minutes) |
| 12:30 PM | Class/Lecture | **Academic** | (Active listening/note-taking) |
| 1:30 PM | **Priority Block 3 (Productive Admin)** | **C** - Complete all quick tasks (emails, organizing digital files, scheduling, short readings). | *Clear out the to-do list noise.* |
| 2:30 PM | Class/Lecture/Lab | **Academic** | |
| 3:30 PM | **Buffer Time/Review** | **C** - Check tomorrow's schedule and assignments. Do a quick **5-minute cleanup** of your study space. | *Use this time to catch up if running behind.* |

---

### III. Evening Review & Planning (4:30 PM â€“ 9:00 PM)

| Time Slot | Activity | Focus/Priority | Notes/Assignment |
| :---: | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 4:30 PM | Break/Activity | **Movement/Social** | (Gym, club meeting, call a friend) |
| 6:00 PM | Dinner | **Personal Care** | (Cook or eat, step away from desk) |
| 7:00 PM | **Priority Block 4 (Review/Prep)** | **B/C** - Work on easier or larger, ongoing projects. Review today's lecture material. | *Consolidate learning from the day.* |
| 8:30 PM | **Daily Plan** | **Logistics** | **Review the Daily Triage Section below.** Set goals for tomorrow. |

---

### IV. Daily Triage & Priority System

Before starting your day (or the night before), quickly triage your tasks:

| Priority | Definition | Action |
| :---: | :---: | :--- |
| **A** | **Urgent & Important** | **Must** be done today. (Due today, exam review, critical research). |
| **B** | **Important but Not Urgent** | Work on these after 'A' tasks. (Due in 2-3 days, reading for next week's discussion, large project component). |
| **C** | **Non-Urgent Tasks** | Group these and do them in bulk during **Productive Admin** time. (Emails, organizing notes, textbook highlighting, small errands). |

#### **To-Do List for Today:**

1. **(A) ______________________________________________ (e.g., Finish Physics Lab Report)**
2. **(B) ______________________________________________ (e.g., Outline History Paper)**
3. **(C) ______________________________________________ (e.g., Reply to Advisor Email)**

#### **Assignment Check-In:**

* **Assignment Due Today:** ________________________________
* **Next Assignment Due:** ________________________________
* **Total Study Hours Completed:** **_______** (Aim for 4â€“6 focused hours)

---

### V. Late Evening & Wind Down (9:00 PM Onward)

| Time Slot | Activity | Focus/Priority | Notes/Assignment |
| :---: | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 9:00 PM | Hobbies/Relaxation | **Wellbeing** | (Reading, music, gaming, or time with friends/family) |
| 10:00 PM | Prep for Tomorrow | **Logistics** | (Pack bag, plan outfit, charge devices) |
| 10:30 PM | Wind Down Routine | **Personal Care** | (Meditation or quiet reading) |
| 11:00 PM | Sleep | **Recharge** | (7â€“9 hours recommended) |
